questions.question: A type of crime in which your private information is stolen and used for financial gain?

choices.answer: Identification
Burglary
Identity Theft
Breaking and Entering

questions.question: You find a message on your phone that you think might be a scam, you should:

choices.answer: Forward the message to friends
Respond and tell the sender not to send any more messages
Open the message to see what it is
Delete the message and block the number

questions.question: Which is most likely an example of a online phishing spam?

choices.answer: Your friend sends you an email to thier personal blog
An email from an unknown sender asking to fill out a prize form
pop up window on your schools website alerting you to the lunch menu
text message from your coach that your game is cancelled
Roverware, Speechware, Aboutware
Adware, Ransomware,Spyware
Abware, Randomware, Stealthware
Speedware,Readyware,Allware

questions.question: Why do we protect ourselves and our identity online?

choices.answer: Hackers might scam us
Don't worry no one is out to get you
Private information might be stolen
Everything is free, why worry

questions.question: Which is NOT an example of online phishing?

choices.answer: Sense of Urgency
Generic Greeting
Alert that your account is in trouble
All are examples of Phishing

questions.question: Which is NOT a way to prevent online phishing?

choices.answer: Click on unprotected links or attachments
Don't reply
Report junk or spam mail to social network
Call the company through customer service

questions.question: How does Identity Theft affect your future?

choices.answer: All are ways Identity Theft affects your future
Ruin financial credit
Takes time and money to clean up
Targets families and steals their money

questions.question: How can you defend yourself against online phishing scams?

choices.answer: Be aware of fake emails
Never send emails to people you don't know be sure
Never click on links/attachments unless you are sure
All are examples of ways to defend yourself against online phishing
all hackers wear black ski masks
you have to be a male to be a social engineering hacker
using manipulation, influence and deception to get personal information
using social media sites to get an engineering degree

questions.question: Which of these helps to avoid malware?

choices.answer: updating regularly
opening attachments from strangers
not using AntiVirus software
not going to questionable websites

questions.question: What things should you look for to detect a phishy email?

choices.answer: Contains links or attachments
Requests personal or sensitive information
All of these things
High sense of urgency and/or privacy
Security is a myth and I don't need to protect myself
You could become a victim of fraud/identity theft
You could have confidential data published or stolen
Everyone in the world gets along, so I don't need to be safe
